CatDescriptText: Mr. Ellis Jefferson, truck driver, 529 West Lacock St., was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 7, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that Negroes should push for non-segregated cemeteries, or should they sponsor their own?"  Answer reads: "Push for non-segregation in everything, both the living and the dead."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ellis Jefferson wearing light colored ribbed sweater with striped trim and single button, standing on sidewalk in front of sign
